meteringrange: EV 1 - 18, with Dual Pixel CMOS AF at 23° C (73° F) and ISO 100
isospeedrange: For Stills: Manual setting range of ISO 100-12,800, expansion to ISO 25,600 equivalent Shooting Mode ISO Settings Auto, Flash Off, Creative Auto 100~6400 Scene Modes Portrait, Close-up, Sports, Night Portrait, HDR Backlight Control 100~6400 Landscape 100~1600 Handheld Night Scene 100~12800 P, Tv, Av, M 100~12800 1 B 400 1 With Flash 400 2 1. Depends on the minimum and maximum of Auto ISO setting. 2. Depends on the minimum and maximum of Auto ISO setting: If shooting in bright light results in overexposure, the ISO speed can be set as low as ISO 100. Auto, Night Portrait and Handheld Night Scenes are excluded. If you use bounce flash with an external Speedlite in the Creative Auto, Portrait, Landscape, Close-up, Sports or P modes, the ISO speed is set automatically within ISO 400-1600.
shutterspeeds: 1/8,000 to 30 seconds, X-sync at 1/250 second. Total shutter speed range. Available range varies by shooting mode
afworkingrange: Center AF Point: EV -0.5 to 18 Other AF Points: EV 0 to EV 18 At 23° C (73° F) and ISO 100, w/ Canon's testing standards
drivemodes: Single High-speed continuous shooting Low-speed continuous shooting Silent Single Shooting Silent Continuous Shooting 10 second self-timer / remote control 2 second self-timer / remote control
flashexposurecompensation: Up to ± 3 stops in 1/3- or 1/2-stop increments
batterycheck: Automatic battery level check when power is turned on. Battery level is displayed in 6 levels
dpof: Digital Print Order Format Version 1.1 compatible
picturestyle: Auto, Standard, Portrait, Landscape, Neutral, Faithful, Monochrome, User Defined 1, 2, 3
settings: Auto, Preset (Daylight; Shade; Cloudy, Twilight, Sunset; Tungsten light; White Fluorescent Light; Flash), Custom:  2,000 ~ 10,000° K, Color Temperature:  2,500 ~ 10,000° K
griddisplay: 3 Grid displays provided 1) Grid 1: 3 vertical and 3 horizontal lines 2) Grid 2: 6 vertical and 4 horizontal lines 3) Grid 3: 3 vertical and 3 horizontal lines + diagonal
exposurecontrol: 1) Program AE for movie shooting In Basic Zone modes, P, Av, and Tv modes, Shutter speed 1/30 ~ 1/4000 sec. (Signal accumulation time), aperture, and ISO speed automatically set. 2) Manual exposure Shutter speed (signal accumulation time), aperture, and ISO speed (auto/manual) manually set. The shutter speed (signal accumulation time) is limited to 1/4000 sec. at the maximum and to 1/30 sec. at the minimum for 24/25/30 fps or 1/60 sec. or higher for 50/60 fps.
weight: Body Only: 675g (23.8 oz) Body only Lens Only: 480g (16.9 oz) Combined: 875g (30.8 oz)
erase: Erase: single image, selected images, all images on folder, all images in a card, or erase only unprotected images
afassistbeam: Intermittent firing of built-in flash Effective range: ~4m (13.1 ft) at center, ~3.5m (11.5 ft) at periphery - With an EOS-dedicated Speedlite attached, the Speedlite's AF-assist beam is emitted instead. - Compatible with AF assist-beam (intermittent firing) of 320EX, 270EX II and 270EX flashes.
shutterlagtime: 1) During SW-1 ON, time lag between SW-2 ON and start of exposure:  0.065 second 2) Time lag between simultaneous SW-1/SW-2 ON and start of exposure: ~0.14 second About 0.18 sec. in case of silent shooting. Time lag with the aperture stopped down by 3.5 stops or less (Excludes AF operation time).
aelock: (1) Auto AE lock: In the One-Shot AF mode with evaluative metering, AE lock takes effect when focus is achieved. (2) Manual AE lock: Enabled with the AE lock button (Press again to update.) in all metering modes. Enabled with the AE lock button (Press again to update.) in all metering modes.
mymenuregistration: Up to six top-tier menu options and Custom Function settings can be registered
protection: Erase protection can be applied or canceled for a single image, all images in a folder, or all images in the card.
highlightalert: With single-image display (Information) and single-image display, overexposed highlight areas will blink
datetimebattery: Built-in secondary battery. The Date/Time Battery is not replaceable by the user. It recharges when LP-E6 is loaded or when the AC adapter is connected. Without any recharging, the backup battery can maintain the date/time for ~3 months. The backup battery taxes ~8 hours to be fully recharged.
fileformats: MOV: Movie: MPEG-4 AVC / H.264 w/ variable (average) bit rate Audio: Linear PCM Meta information is embedded in the MOV file (no separate THM file)
shootingmodes: Still photo shooting and video recording
items: When you press the Quick Control function button under the following conditions, you can set the functions below depending on the shooting mode. 1) Viewfinder shooting: Shutter speed, aperture, ISO speed, exposure compensation/ AEB, flash exposure compensation, Picture Style, White balance, White balance correction/White balance bracketing, Auto Lighting Optimizer, Metering mode, AF operation, Drive mode/Self-timer, image-recording quality, Flash firings, Ambience-based shots, Light/scene-based shots, Special scene modes, and wireless LAN connection 2) Live View shooting: Scene Setting, AF method, Drive mode, Metering mode, Image-recording quality, White balance, Picture Style, Auto Lighting Optimizer, Creative Filters, Flash firing, Ambience-based shots, Light/scene-based shots, and Background blurring/sharpening. 3) Movie shooting: AF Method, Drive mode, Movie-recording size, Digital zoom, White Balance, Picture Style, Auto Lighting Optimizer and Video Snapshot. When you press the Quick Control function button under the following conditions, you can set the functions below: 1) During still photo playback: Image protect, image rotate, rating, Creative Filters, resize, Cropping, and image jump with Main Dial 2) During movie playback: Image protect, rating, and image jump with Main Dial
colortemperaturecompensation: Blue/Amber bias: ±9 levels, correction based on the current WB mode's color temperature
flashcoverage: Up to 17mm focal length  ~27mm in 135 format equivalent)
powersaving: Power turns off after the set time of non-operation (1, 2, 4, 8, 15 or 30 minutes or disabled)
interfacelanguages: 25 (English, German, French, Dutch, Danish, Portuguese, Finnish, Italian, Norwegian, Swedish, Spanish, Greek, Russian, Polish, Hungarian, Czech, Romanian, Ukraine, Turkish, Arabic, Thai, Simplified and Traditional Chinese, Korean and Japanese)
battery: 1x LP-E6 Battery Pack With the AC Adapter Kit ACK-E6, AC power is possible. Optional: Battery Grip BG-E14 fits 2x LP-E6 Battery Packs.
recordingmedia: SD card, SDHC card, SDXC memory card.            Compatible with Ultra High Speed (UHS-I) memory cards and Eye-Fi cards (Built-in wireless LAN cannot be used simultaneously with Eye-Fi cards).
batterylife: Camera Body w/ 1x LP-E6 Battery: Temperature AE 100% 50% Flash Use Viewfinder Shooting, 23° C ~1,000 Shots ~800 Shots Viewfinder Shooting, 0° C ~900 Shots ~750 Shots Live View Shooting, 23° C ~230 Shots ~220 Shots Live View Shooting, 0° C ~210 Shots ~200 Shots Camera Body w/ 1x LP-E6 Battery: Shooting Method Temperature Possible Shots AE 100% AE 50%, FA 50% Viewfinder Shooting 23° C ~1,300 920 0° C ~1,200 850 Live View Shooting 23° C ~230 ~210 0° C ~210 ~200 With Battery Grip BG-E14 Installed: Chart data from CIPA (Camera & Imaging Products Assoc.) testing standards, with fully charged batteries. Shooting Method Power Source Temperature Maximum Possible Shots AE 100% AE 50%, FA 50% Viewfinder Shooting 1x LP-E6 23° C ~1,300 ~920 0° C ~1,200 ~850 2x LP-E6 23° C ~2,600 ~1,840 0° C ~2,400 ~1,700 Size AA Batteries 23° C ~490 ~320 0° C ~90 ~50 Live View Shooting 1x LP-E6 23° C ~230 ~210 0° C ~210 ~200 2x LP-E6 23° C ~460 ~420 0° C ~420 ~400 Size AA Batteries 23° C N/A N/A 0° C N/A N/A
recordingformat: Complies with design rule for Camera File System 2.0 and Exif 2.30
filesize: Full HD: 1920 x 1080 (30 fps/25fps/24fps): 235 MB/min. with IPB compression 685 MB/min. with All-I compression HD: 1280 x 720 (60 fps/50fps): 205 MB/min. with IPB compression 610 MB/min. with All-I compression SD: 640 x 480 (30 fps/25fps): 78 MB/min. with IPB compression
filenumbering: The following three types of file numbers can be set: (1) Continuous Numbering - The continuous numbering of captured images will continue even after you replace the camera's card. (The numbering continues even when the folder changes.) (2) Auto Reset - When you replace the camera's card, the numbering will be reset to start from 0001. If the new card already contains images, the numbering will continue from the last recorded image in the card. (3) Manual Reset - Resets the file number to 0001, and creates a new folder automatically.
histogram: Brightness and RGB can be displayed
imageformat: Still: JPEG, RAW Video: MOV (Image data: H.264, Audio: Linear PCM)
focusing: Dual Pixel CMOS AF: 1) One-shot AF 2) Servo AF 3) Manual Focus Magnify the image by ~5x or ~10x and focus manually. AF using AF point selection: Face Detection plus Tracking AF FlexiZone - Multi, 31 zones,     AF at the touched zone FlexiZone - Single
afpoints: 19 points Cross Type AF All AF points are cross-type at f/5.6 Center AF point is cross-type at f/2.8
focusingmodes: 1) Autofocus - One-Shot AF - AI Servo AF - AI Focus AF Switches between One-Shot AF and AI Servo AF 2) Manual Focus
exposurecompensation: Up to ±3 stops in 1/3-stop increments For movies, exposure compensation will not be applied beyond ±3 stops even if the exposure compensation has been set beyond ±3 stops. For still photo shooting, the exposure compensation can be set and applied up to ±5 stops.
selectedafpointdisplay: Indicated by translucent liquid crystal display in the viewfinder and on the LCD monitor
continuousshooting: High-speed continuous shooting: Up to ~7.0 fps At 1/500 sec. or faster shutter speed, and at the maximum aperture (varies depending on the lens) Low-speed continuous shooting: Up to ~3.0 fps Silent continuous shooting: Up to ~3.0 fps.
videooutterminal: HDMI Type C (Switches automatically to suit the resolution) Video output: 1080/60i, 1080/50i, 480/60p, 576/50p Switches video resolutions automatically to suit the TV
meteringmodes: TTL maximum aperture metering w/ 63-zone metering sensor: 1) Evaluative metering (linked to all AF points) 2) Partial metering (center, ~ 7.7% of viewfinder) 3) Spot metering (center, ~ 3.0% of viewfinder) 4) Center-weighted average metering
printableimages: RAW, JPEG and Raw + JPEG images complying to Design rule for Camera File System
scenemodes: Portrait, Close-up, Sports, Night Portrait, HDR Backlight Control100~6400
lowpassfilter: Fixed position in front of the image sensor
viewfinderinformation: AF information: AF points, focus confirmation, AF area selection mode Exposure information: Shutter speed, aperture, ISO speed (always displayed), AE lock, exposure level, spot metering circle, exposure warning Flash information: Flash ready, flash exposure compensation, high-speed sync, FE lock, red-eye reduction light Image information: Highlight tone priority (D+), maximum burst (2-digit display), card information Composition information Grid, electronic level Alert symbol
customcontrols: The following camera controls can be customized by assigning the desired function:  Shutter button halfway pressing, AF-ON button, AE lock button, Depth-of-field preview button, Lens AF Stop button, SET button, Main Dial, Quick Control Dial, and Multi-controller
maximumburst: Based on 8GB memory Card: JPEG Large/Fine: ~40 Shots RAW: ~ 15 Shots RAW+JPEG Large/Fine: 8 Shots Based on 8GB UHS-I memory card: JPEG Large/Fine: ~64 Shots RAW: ~ 16 Shots RAW + JPEG Large / Fine: 8 Shots Figures are based on Canon's testing standards: ISO 100 and Standard Picture Style. At ISO 12800, maximum burst will greatly decrease due to internal processing.
whitebalance: Auto White Balance with the Image Sensor
